1.text: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

2.text: For length of days, and years of life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

3.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

4.text: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

5.text: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart, and lean not upon thine own understanding:

6.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

7.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the LORD, and depart from evil:

8.text: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

9.text: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

10.text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine.

11.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his reproof:

12.text: For whom the LORD loveth he reproveth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

13.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

14.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies: and none of the things thou canst desire are to be compared unto her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right had; in her left hand are riches and honour.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

19.text: The LORD by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding he established the heavens.

20.text: By his knowledge the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.

21.text: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion;

22.text: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

23.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

24.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh:

26.text: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

27.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

28.text: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

29.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

31.text: Envy thou not the man of violence, and choose none of his ways.

32.text: For the perverse is an abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the upright.

33.text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked; but he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.

34.text: Surely he scorneth the scorners, but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

35.text: The wise shall inherit glory; but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
